title: Shaza inaugurates Pakistan pavilion at GITEX Global 2025
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 13 (APP):Federal Minister for IT & Telecom, Shaza Fatima Khawaja, on Monday, inaugurated Pakistan’s Tech Destination Pavilion at GITEX Global 2025, marking a powerful continuation of the country’s rise as a global technology hub.
The inauguration ceremony was also attended by  Additional Secretary Ministry of IT& Telecom & CEO Ignite,  Faisal Tirmizi, Ambassador of Pakistan to UAE, Brigadier Nadir, Special Investment Facilitation Council, (SIFC), CEO of the Pakistan Software Export Board (PSEB),  Abu Bakar, CEO National Information Technology Board (NITB), Faisal Ratyal, and Chairman P@SHA,  Syed Sajjad, said a news release received here.
The event drew participation from industry leaders, international investors, and global media.
The Pavilion serves as a central hub for B2B meetings, investment networking, partnership announcements, and startup showcases, creating a vibrant platform for international collaboration.
Visitors can experience live demos, tech innovations, and business matchmaking sessions aimed at strengthening Pakistan’s footprint in global technology trade.
Shaza Fatima Khawaja, praised the growing global footprint of Pakistan’s IT sector, stating: “Pakistan’s presence at GITEX Global reflects our confidence, our capability, and our commitment to a digitally empowered future under the leadership of Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Vision of Digital Nation Pakistan. With a young, skilled workforce and an expanding base of IT exports, Pakistan is ready to play a central role in shaping the global tech economy. The Pakistan Pavilion represents not just our innovation – but our invitation to the world to partner in growth.”
The Ministry is facilitating the participation of 10 promising start-ups at GITEX in Dubai, one of the world’s largest technology and innovation events.
By organizing and supporting this delegation, the Ministry aims to showcase local entrepreneurial talent on a global stage, attract international investment, and foster business development opportunities.
This initiative reflects the Ministry’s ongoing commitment to nurturing innovation and accelerating the growth of the start-up ecosystem.
Following Pakistan’s recognition as “Tech Destination of the Year” at GITEX Global 2024, this year’s presence signifies a bold step forward – with 20+ leading IT and tech companies from Pakistan participating under the national pavilion to showcase their products, services, and digital solutions to a worldwide audience.
